channel.title: What is runescape based off of?
channel.description: Hey I have been wondering what runescape is based off of. Is it PHP or is it JAVA>?

Oh really.

item.title: What is runescape based off of?
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:39, topic:327402”][quote author=Jamie1200 link=topic=423791.msg3115647#msg3115647 date=1264945119]

It’s not based off Java, it’s programmed in the Java language. However, they’ve created their own scripting language, called ‘RuneScript’ (Based off the Java programming language), which they program Runescape in.

Are you completely retarded…You just said it isn’t based off of java.

Don’t call him stupid when you think RuneScape is programmed in PHP. I lol’d when I read that.

There are games programmed with PHP, they’re browser based, perhaps you didn’t know that.

Actually, its not PHP based games, the sites php based, games are Flash or JavaScript mostly.

Sites are HTML based…PHP = Hypertext Preprocessor (HTML-embedded scripting language)

GTFO, my websites are Java-based.

Thats written in HTML, the java is just placed into it.
[/quote]
No, my websites are written in Java![/quote]

OK you obviously trolling. Please stop.

Read full topic
item.source: What is runescape based off of?

Don’t call him stupid when you think RuneScape is programmed in PHP. I lol’d when I read that.

There are games programmed with PHP, they’re browser based, perhaps you didn’t know that.

Actually, its not PHP based games, the sites php based, games are Flash or JavaScript mostly.

Sites are HTML based…PHP = Hypertext Preprocessor (HTML-embedded scripting language)

GTFO, my websites are Java-based.
[/quote]

Thats written in HTML, the java is just placed into it.[/quote]
No, my websites are written in Java!

item.title: What is runescape based off of?
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:28, topic:327402”][quote author=B2300 T4nk link=topic=423791.msg3114380#msg3114380 date=1264838958]

The client has NOTHING to do with ‘runescript’ what they may or may not use on the server side we can’t know. But the client is written in Java.

Are you sure?

I always thought the RS stood for RuneScript, so I guess I was mistaken. Would you mind telling me what it is please?

The RS in RSString? That is just some random name a fellow cheater came up with when refactoring the client, we don’t know what it is named at jagex.

Galkon refactored it, right?

Many different people refactored it independently over the course of time. I’ve never heard of Galkon though.
[/quote]Galkon is best with clients.

I don’t really know how you can be very good with clients, all the code is provided for you and it doesn’t take much to get it to run. Unless you mean something else.[/quote]He can do anything related to clients. He made the best refractored client there is.

Read full topic

item.title: What is runescape based off of?
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

Moparisthebest:

The client has NOTHING to do with ‘runescript’ what they may or may not use on the server side we can’t know. But the client is written in Java.

The client is written in java, and as of the upgrade to the RuneTek 5 game-engine, graphics are 100% OpenGl now, RuneTek 4 (508-554 HD) was also in openGl, however if i recall the ld version (RuneTek 3) was not and ran on a similar engine to RuneTek 2 (beta-502? or so) with some basic modifications.

Most likely server sided, most people presume that it is written in C, however some speculate it might be written is another language.

Runescape is based off a real shitty Mud called DeviousMud or so in 1999-ish that later became the runescape we know today after a new engine was added to make it runescape classic.

Read full topic
item.source: What is runescape based off of?
